Author: asdflkj
Content: I don't think anyone is claiming that it's "the whole explanation". It's only an explanation for why people don't care about other people, which sometimes has violence and suffering as a side effect. In other cases, violence and suffering is purposeful, and this happens for other reasons.

Author: Goladus
Content:
And even then it's probably only certain applications. Office plugins seem to be among the worst offenders in my experience. I remember problems with both IBM Rational and FileNet Panagon. Those are both huge software packages developed by big companies, so I don't know how much blame to lay on microsoft.

Barring hard drive issues, I've never had to reinstall the OS on my personal PC.

Author: mdemare
Content: At last Rails catches up with the web...

Author: rms
Content:
$150/month for phones?

I don't know what I'm going to do when Sprint kicks me off of my old Radioshack employee plan. $35/month with taxes for 3000 minutes, 7PM nights, unlimited text messaging, "unlimited" EVDO and a $50/month credit towards anything you can buy from within the phone software, like games and ringtones and Pandora and Loopt.

Author: rms
Content: If you bet half on red and half on black you can't lose!

Author: zach
Content: "If you took our top fifteen decisions out, we'd have a pretty average record." - Charlie Munger, Berkshire Hathaway

Author: leoc
Content: Dunbar's number really can't be the whole explanation of man's inhumanity to man. Among primitive societies where people live as small bands in which everyone knows everyone, the murder rate is high. (According to /Guns, Germs and Steel/.) There's certainly lots of intracommunal violence and nastiness among most other ape bands too. And don't people in our society tend to be murdered by people they knew?

Author: Goladus
Content: No hate here.  I just haven't heard any reason good enough for me to spend cash on it.  I'm opposed to DRM, so I'd need a really good reason to upgrade to begin with.
